post_text: During the summer of 2019 the Wilmington High School Athletic Department will be sponsoring a series of sports clinics for children in Grades 1-8. All clinics (except Track) will be held at Wilmington Middle School (25 Carter Lane) Please note this is a location change from last year. All clinics will be run by WHS Coaches, Alumni and Athletes. The cost of each clinic is $175 per child per clinic with the exception of Boys Soccer and Track which has a cost $150 per child. Additional clinic enrollment is discounted $25 per clinic. (i.e. Siblings attending camps are $175 each; the next camp is $150 per child per clinic). Complete flyer and registration form available at https://www.wpsk12.com/domain/301

post_text:
STRATEGIC PLAN PLANNING GROUP

Parents/Guardians, Students, Staff, Administrators and Community Representatives

If you are interested in being involved in the Strategic Plan Planning Group, please forward your interest by email to strategicplan@wpsk12.com by Friday, November 30th. Please indicate which group you are representing (parent/guardian, student, staff, administrator, community member). The meetings will be held from 2:00pm - 5:30pm on the following dates, at a location to be determined, and you must be able to commit to all four (4) dates:

Thursday, December 13
Thursday, February 14
Friday, March 15
Monday, May 6

Thank you in advance for your interest and commitment.

post_text:
As a result of the conditions this morning with close to eight inches of heavy snow, the Wilmington Public Schools will operate under a two-hour delay. Given this delay the following will apply:

* Transportation will begin their schedules and pick-up times two hours later
* Schools will be dismissed at their regular times
* Meal service will take place in the cafeteria
* Preschool a.m. sessions will be cancelled
* All before-school programs will be cancelled, but all after-school activities and programs will operate under their normal schedule, unless otherwise noted.
* The morning sessions of CARES will be cancelled, but afternoon sessions will operate on a normal schedule

post_text:
Greetings,

As I am sure many are aware, with the exception of the Wilmington High School, none of the other schools in the district have building-wide air conditioning. While some schools benefit from AC in a few common spaces and classrooms, the vast majority of instructional spaces throughout our district do not.

Although forecasts point to temperatures being slightly lower tomorrow, it appears that the humidity is expected to rise. These factors, coupled with little opportunity for the built-up heat to dissipate overnight, will quickly lead to conditions that again will be extremely challenging.

Given continued concerns for the overall well-being of all who are asked to occupy these…

post_text:
Due to the current forecast for the continued excessive heat warning, there will be an Early Release on Wednesday, August 29, 2018. All schools will follow the normal early release schedule (3 hours earlier than normal release). There will be no afternoon CARES or afternoon/evening activities.

I want to assure you that the safety of our students and staff is the priority in making these decisions. While I recognize that the timing is unfortunate given our start of school this week, the extreme conditions anticipated for tomorrow are of even greater concern than today.
Please note that revised orientation schedules for parents/guardians of incoming pre-school and kindergarten students will be sent out by the Early Childhood Directors later this evening.

The early release schedule is as follows:
Middle School 10:40
High School 11:05
North Intermediate 11:25
Woburn Street 11:25
West Intermediate 12:00
Shawsheen Elementary 12:00
Thank you for your understanding.

Sincerely,
Glenn Brand
Superintendent of Schools

post_text:
Due to the current forecast for snow, ice and rain there will be an Early Release on Wednesday, February 7, 2018. All schools will follow the normal early release schedule (3 hours earlier than normal release). There will be no PM Preschool, afternoon CARES or afternoon/evening activities.

I want to assure you that the safety of our students and staff is the priority in making these decisions and that I am in constant communication with DPW, Public Buildings and our weather service.

The early release schedule is as follows:

Boutwell Early Childhood Center = 10:15
Middle School = 10:40
High School = 11:05
Wildwood Early Childhood Center = 11:05
North Intermediate = 11:25
Woburn Street = 11:25
West Intermediate = 12:00
Shawsheen Elementary = 12:00

Sincerely,
Paul Ruggiero
Interim Superintendent
Wilmington Public Schools

post_text:
WPS 2017 Youth Risk Behavior Survey Results

Wilmington Public Schools administered the Youth Risk Behavior Survey (YRBS) to the middle and high schools in the spring of 2017. The YRBS was developed by the United States Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) to monitor health behaviors among middle school and high school students. The data the survey collects help schools, government agencies, and community organizations develop health programs and drug abuse and bullying prevention plans. Follow-up waves of YRBS data can be used to monitor progress toward meeting program
benchmarks.

To view the results, please visit the following links:
Wilmington High School:
shared_text:
WILMINGTON-HS-YRBS-2017.ROTHENBACH-RESEARCH.COM
Wilmington High School YRBS –
